text: Let's talk about the next of our time-frame participants. The day trader. The day trader tends to enter the market with no position. More importantly the day trader leaves the market without a position. It has zero risk overnight. Day traders tend to use technical analysis and real order flow in order to make trading decisions. Fundamentals tend to be slightly counter-intuitive to the day trading participant as they tend to hinder the day trader as opposed to adding value. Let's take a look at the same example used in the scalping in the previous slide. As we can see we have an inside day. Traditionally inside day breaks day traders tend to play or go with the break. As we can see, day traders will enter the market or will enter the market once we take out the previous day's high. They will be looking to hold for a continuation type pattern to the upside. However, do note, day traders manage risk very effectively and any attempt at the market to re-enter the previous day's range, day traders will tend to exit those positions and zero their risk.
